intro: Xiphion papilionaceum, commonly known as the Canary Island daffodil, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant features strap-like, linear leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. It produces a single, erect stem that bears the showy inflorescence. Xiphion papilionaceum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in Mediterranean climates.
